Obama: s personal experience: Obama claims that he was working on the streets and witnessing jobs being shifted overseas. This aspect verifies the authenticity of his claim as it is based on his personal experience during the specified time period.
Economic context: Obama refers to the period from 1985 to 1988 when he was a community organizer in Chicago's South Side. He states that many employers, particularly in the steel industry, were closing their plants and moving jobs overseas. This aspect verifies the authenticity of his claim by providing the economic context of the time.
Clinton: s work on the board: Obama suggests that Clinton's role on the Wal-Mart board was significant. This aspect verifies the authenticity of his claim as it is supported by the New York Times examination of Clinton's work on the board, which states that she pushed for more women in management and a better environmental program.
